audio_caption: The audio begins with two young voices, likely children, greeting the audience with an excited "Hi guys!". They announce they are doing a "back to school shopping" video. One child asks if the others are excited "to go back to school?", to which the others respond with "Yes" and "Yeah". A young girl admits she is "a little bit nervous". An adult female voice reassures her, advising "Don't be nervous, you will be fine." A continuous background hum suggests a public setting with ambient noise.

The audio begins with a female speaker excitedly announcing, "Okay guys, so school is in September 4th..." She mentions that many have already started school in other places and invites listeners to comment on their first day of school experiences if they've already begun, asking if it was good or if they were nervous. The audio concludes with indistinct speech.

The clip starts with a female speaker enthusiastically saying, "So guys, are you excited to start shopping?" followed by the word "yeah." She then says, "Okay, look Zidan, Zack would like this one. Get it." and then, "Oh, no, just like, show it to me." She proceeds to say, "This is so cute, you should get it Zidan" and she asks "You're not into Minions anymore?" Another female exclaims, "What's only? They're so pretty. Are they good quality?" followed by a question inaudible because it's spoken by a child in the background. The first female speaks again, commenting "Wow, these are nice." She then directs a comment to a child: "Fashion pencils. Oh, they're right here, Heidi." She continues, "Oh, these are pretty cheap. You wanna get one? Okay, I hope they're good though." Then, she comments that she's "getting nervous." A child says, "Look, I got this one" followed by an adult female saying, "Heidi, this is so nice! I love it. Me too." She continues, "Okay, good choice, Heidi." The background ambience of the clip includes sounds that suggest a public, likely commercial, environment, such as a store or a market, where the speakers are located.

The audio clip starts with a female speaker noting that "Hediel just said that she is actually getting very nervous." Hediel's voice then expresses nervousness because "it feels like award is school today." The first female speaker expresses sympathy and comments on the cat theme from the previous year, hoping this year will be the same, in an inquisitive tone. A male voice expresses agreement or encouragement as the first female speaker continues looking for something, suggesting, "we should get it." Someone mentions "loose papers," suggesting the current activity is likely related to school. Throughout the clip, ambient sounds suggest an indoor environment, potentially a classroom or office space with people moving around and general background noise.

The clip starts with one female speaker admiring something and asking others to join in. There's a noticeable sense of playfulness in her voice. The scene is set in a public place with the ambient noise of children talking, suggesting it's a recreational or retail environment. The speaker shifts her focus to what appears to be a child, presumably asking what she's doing, the child responds. There's a discussion involving makeup and paint, with the child clarifying that the items are for school. The child's excitement is evident as they talk about the colors. Someone then questions if a crayon is present, to which the child replies with a yes.  It's later confirmed that a sketching tool is available, which the child proudly affirms they have. It's clarified that these are not just standard colors, but highlighters as well, which the child already knows. There's a discussion that the item is a nice glue, then a humorous event described. The child notes an incident where an item was dropped and landed in a specific way. The child confirms the presence of pencil crayons. A suggestion is made to explore another area of the environment.

The audio opens with a female speaker asking the price of an item, then identifies it as a binder pouch to hold school supplies, describing its function. She expresses enthusiasm for the item, noting its neatness and good price. Another female suggests someone should look at a particular item, and tells her to follow. A young girl protests and says she is nervous, the first female speaker acknowledges this. The child notices another item and excitedly opens it, finding it's a pencil case. She expresses her delight and her mother encourages her to consider it. It is revealed the pencil case is in the shape of a dog. The child contemplates this, mentioning she likes bunnies. The woman suggests she gets it regardless, describing it as cute and soft. The woman admires its golden eyes. She examines another item and wants to check its inside. She praises it for closing well, helping keep items neat. Finally she asks the child about her experience so far. The audio is punctuated by background sounds of general ambiance, suggesting a busy environment.

The audio clip begins with a female speaking with a slightly inquisitive tone about "Sharpies" and their use in grade two, followed by a playful "I don't know". Another, possibly male, speaker acknowledges someone named "Zidane".  The female speaker expresses satisfaction with "Coloring" and references an item labeled "50". She then poses a comparative question about preferences between "this" and "the Minions". An affirmative response from the second speaker leads the first speaker to ask for agreement among "guys" regarding Zidane's choice.  A third female speaker mentions "really good glue" and praises its effectiveness, particularly noting its use in "grade one." The female speaker concludes by noting a product label with the words "head seal." The audio also features background noise with a consistent volume, suggestive of an ambient public setting, and sounds similar to speech occurring in the background.

The audio begins with speech, where a female speaker mentions using something a lot in grade eight. She's talking about grades, mentioning "going to grade eight", "going to grade two", and "going to grade five". She invites listeners to comment about their grade level. The conversation shifts as she asks a child which grade a friend is going into. The child answers "Two", followed by some chattering between people talking in the background. Then a child expresses a wish "to be with Whitney". Ambient background noise of people speaking can be heard throughout.

The audio clip begins with two female speakers discussing the cuteness of an item. One of them mentions inside and outside rifts, as well as a lot of things happening. Then one of the speakers addresses "Hediyol" and notes that she has found a cat for another. Subsequently, there is a statement made about "Zidan" having changed something, followed by a question of "What?" The speaker then asks "Show it to me," and questions whether the item is bigger. There is a statement that they are all the same size. They then wonder which item should be picked. The speaker mentions the dragon was nice, and there is a response that they like a particular item. All of this takes place with background sounds of children, suggesting the conversation is likely taking place where children are present.

The audio clip begins with two girls speaking in a casual and excited tone. One of them asks the other to show the contents of her basket, then another girl starts describing the items in her basket, including a pencil bag, blue binder, Mr. Sketch markers, and colored pencils. This suggests a playful and enthusiastic atmosphere, possibly a school-related activity. Subsequently, a woman's voice, calmly urging the girls to continue with the unveiling, introduces a new basket belonging to another girl.  She begins to show off her supplies like a cat notebook, a binder, and supplies for pencils, highlighting a playful tone with cat-themed items. Another girl begins to show off her supplies like a pencil case. The woman's voice comes in again asking people to comment on their favorite supplies. There is background noise throughout, seemingly of ambient sound, like a market or school event.

The audio clip begins with children, presumably two female voices, announcing the end of a video and saying goodbye. They encourage viewers to like, share, subscribe, and comment, specifically asking which person has the best basket. The children further instruct the audience to follow them on social media, naming Snapchat, Instagram, and Facebook under the name "Stay Soup Kids Fun". They bid farewell and promise to see viewers in the next video. In the background, there is upbeat, cartoonish jazz music playing, setting a lighthearted and playful tone, which aligns with the kids' fun theme.
